Job Opportunity: Administrator Use your excellent communication and administrative skills to support our team to deliver important services to the community. You will provide administrative support primarily to the Community Service Teams. You will update and maintain customer management systems for the services, provide administrative support for service teams and other meetings and assist with promotional and events activity and other tasks as required. Joining us at Pegasus Health offers an opportunity to be part of a people-centered health service in a dynamic work environment with a unique and vibrant work culture. Pegasus is a Pride Pledge organisation and committed to an inclusive workplace, in which diversity is celebrated. We are a friendly and supportive team of diverse individuals. We believe in achieving equitable health outcomes for all our communities.

Are you passionate about making a difference in the health and wellbeing of the people of Waitaha Canterbury? Pegasus Health is on the lookout for individuals to join our teams. Last week, our incredible Immunisation Coordinator, Rachael Prestidge, delivered an informative session to vaccinators in Waitaha Canterbury, focusing on the updates to the childhood national immunisation schedule. "As an immunisation coordinator, supporting and educating our vaccinators is a vital part of our role," Rachael said. "We conduct sessions throughout the year to ensure their knowledge stays current. This session specifically addressed the recent changes to the childhood national immunisation schedule, including updates to the pneumococcal vaccine and the addition of the meningococcal B vaccine. When vaccinators are aware of the reasons behind changes it supports them to confidently discuss these immunisations with whƒÅnau and to recommend tƒÅmariki are immunised". #childhealthawarenessmonth

Yesterday we celebrated the launch of our Refugee Health Service, a confidential and free health service supporting former refugees access healthcare in Christchurch and Ashburton. The Refugee Health service support includes help with general practice (GP) enrolments, guidance through initial GP appointments, interpretation services, and assistance in accessing various health services including pharmacies, labs, maternity care, optometry, dental care and other health related support as needed. A heartfelt thank you goes out to the incredible team involved in bringing this service to life, an important step in supporting former refugees in their journey in Aotearoa. Looking for a new #CareerOpportunity in the #HealthSector? Check out the Senior Infrastructure Engineer position at Pegasus Health! This is a great opportunity for an experienced Specialist with systems, networking, and cloud experience to join the infrastructure team on their journey towards a DevOps environment. Pegasus Health works collaboratively across the health system, partnering with people, professions, general practice, organisations, and the wider community to bring the people of Waitaha Canterbury the best primary care system we can. Our Business Information Services (BIS) team comprises a broad range of technology professionals who deliver an extensive range of technology services to our large customer base. Each summer, Pegasus Health opens its doors to a vibrant group of interns through our Students in Over Summer Programme, aiming to enrich our collective expertise and bring new insights into equitable healthcare practices. In our latest intake for 2023, we were thrilled to have nursing and counseling students join us, gaining invaluable hands-on experience across various teams. Zaria Grant, expressed her time at Pegasus through poetry. We're proud to share her poem, a celebration of growth, learning, and the power of innovative expression in understanding equitable healthcare.
